alert.note: Alert for Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:40PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bradley, southeastern Sequatchie, southwestern Meigs, southeastern Marion and Hamilton Counties through 845 PM EDT/745 PM CDT/... At 740 PM EDT/640 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Dunlap to 6 miles southwest of Trenton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Cleveland, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Walden, Lakesite, Ridgeside, South Cleveland, Fairmount and Harrison. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT/1000 PM CDT/ for southeast Tennessee.
